definition: to put on makeup/to prettify
to apply (paint etc)/to smear/to daub/to blot out/to scribble/to scrawl/(literary) mud/street
variant of 途[tu2]
surname Tu
fat/rouge (cosmetics)/resin
to wipe
to plaster/to go around/to skirt
to smear/to wipe/to erase/classifier for wisps of cloud, light-beams etc
powder/cosmetic face powder/food prepared from starch/noodles or pasta made from any kind of flour/whitewash/white/pink

sentences.english: She seldom, if ever, paints or powders.
Beauty-conscious women have been powdering their skin since ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 自古以来，向往追求美丽的女人都喜欢涂脂抹粉。

sentences.english: Berlusconi appeared before each time, something must be careful to whitewash it.
sentences.chinese: 老贝每次亮相前，都要细心地涂脂抹粉一番呢。

sentences.english: The other women paint in order to try and look young.
sentences.chinese: 另一种女人涂脂抹粉，尽量显得年轻些。

definition: to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup

lit. to present oneself confidently to the emperor, without makeup (as did the sister of Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1]) (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) to show one's natural features, without makeup/to present oneself just as one is, without artifice
lit. lovely scene of blossoming plants swaying in the breeze (idiom)/fig. gorgeously dressed (woman)
cosmetics
variant of 裝扮|装扮[zhuang1 ban4]
to stroke one's hair coquettishly (idiom)
to sprinkle powder/a dusting
heavy makeup and gaudy dress
face powder and eyebrow liner/cosmetics/(fig.) beautiful woman
natural beauty
lit. countenance of a flower, face like the moon (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) beautiful
graceful/charming/feminine
middle-aged but still attractive woman/lady of a certain age
to decorate/to dress/to make up/to adorn/manner of dressing/style of dress
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
messy hair and dirty face/bad appearance
